name: Forward Guidance
title: Cftc Ya
text:
Synopsis
The CFTC is undergoing leadership transition with potential shifts in crypto regulation, while Ripple is positioning itself for expanded US operations under an anticipated Trump administration.

Key Insights
- CFTC Chair Rostin Behnam will step down on Inauguration Day, with Trump expected to name a new acting chair from current Republican commissioners
- Potential CFTC chair candidates include Caroline Pham, Summer Mersinger, Jill Sommers, Josh Sterling, and Brian Quintenz
- Ripple is expanding US hiring, with approximately 75% of new positions based in the United States
- Ripple anticipates regulatory changes, including potential revocation of SEC guidance and more crypto-friendly frameworks
- Ripple reports closing as many enterprise deals in two months post-election as in the previous six months
- Hut 8, a bitcoin mining company, is planning a significant data center project in Louisiana with potential AI hyperscaler partnership
- Corporations purchased a record amount of bitcoin in Q4 2024, with MicroStrategy leading at 194,180 BTC
- Bitcoin price was around $97,700, down 4% in 24 hours, while Ether dropped over 7% to approximately $3,420
